A child in the 99th percentile is the future adult who creates the new technology, writes the novel, pioneers the business model, composes the symphony, leads the division. An education system that supports the gifted child toward full-blown adult productivity may very well receive an exponential return on its investment.

No one has argued that special needs children should lose resources, only that the special needs of talented children also be addressed.

A gifted child with an IQ of 145 is three standard deviations away from average intelligence. A special needs child whose IQ is three standard deviations away from average intelligence has an IQ of 55. Everyone agrees that the subnormal variant child should get special services. Shouldn't the supranormal child receive equivalent benefits; after all, the degree of difference is the same!

In 2000 I was dead set against the Electoral College and wanted it abolished. I have second thoughts. Why should a corrupt governor rig the election in Florida, for example and steal an election. On the other hand if we abolish the Electoral College for the popular vote we have a truly nationwide election but as long as we have a national party whose aim is to win an any cost, who believes that they must govern and the ends justify the means, as now, then the pool of prospective voters shall by limited to reflect the interests of that party.

Abolishing the Electoral College requires a constitutional amendment and then we can revamp and federalize all election laws for federal office. In addition to the repeal of the Electoral College, that amendment can provide: That all U.S. citizens, native or naturalized over the age of 18 years are entitled to vote regardless of previous criminal convictions who are not actually imprisoned as the result of a final conviction for a felony:

That for the 30 consecutive days prior to the day of election fixed by the Constitution between the hours of 7:00 am and 9:00 pm qualified voters upon oath or affirmation on pain of conviction for perjury swearing or attesting to their place of residence, their date of birth and their citizenship and length of residence in the country were the vote is cast, shall be entitled to vote and all polls shall be open and staffed..

In Massachusetts, the states Community Choices Program provides up to 24/7 in-home care.  In is the the state's best kept secret.  If an individual is enrolled in Medicaid and has the functional limitations that make them eligible to have Medicaid pay for their care in a nursing facility then they are eligible for the Community Choices Program.  There is no requirement that the individual's family members help out with care.  Also, the individual does not have to have lived in a nursing facility.  This program has helped many individuals who want to leave a nursing home return to the community and has allowed many who were at risk of moving to a nursing home stay at home.   The problem is that there is no limit on the cost of the in-home care. Some individuals in the program receive more than $200,000 of in-home care a year; a cost far greater than the annual cost of a nursing facility.

Arty: I suspect you don't have the requisite mathematical knowledge. I said the *state space* of the climate system is infinite dimensional. In general terms, it can be described as an interacting collection of fields (fluid flow, radiation flux, etc.)--partial differential equations, not ordinary differential equations. A state of the system at a single moment in time must specify the values of all these quantities over the entire 3d volume of the atmosphere and oceans--an infinite number of values.

Contrast with the three body problem (which is also chaotic). Here we are dealing with a system of ordinary differential equations where the state of each body can be described with just two quantities--position and momentum--so the state space is only 6-dimensional.

Are you clear on that now? Please let us know if you don't understand.

And you shouldn't be making any assumption about what "group" I'm in. My group, if you must know, is "mathematicians" and I am not a denier.
